title: Preserve Objective-C runtime selector compatibility while exporting async throws method surfaces as C thunks
feature: C/ObjC runtime interop for async/throws ABI surfaces

mode_matrix.name: debug-o0
abi_requirements: Objective-C method selector surface remains compute: while C thunk exports async throws behavior through canonical completion ABI
C thunk for method export preserves trailing context and completion parameters after source method arguments
status/error mapping for method thunk matches async-throws C boundary invariants for success, failure, and cancellation
separate compilation preserves callable method thunk declaration for C and Objective-C translation units
runtime_assertions: intc12_runtime_selector resolves to @selector(compute:) without async/throws ABI suffix changes
intc12_probe_callback executes exactly once per thunk invocation and observes stable status/error contract

mode_matrix.name: optimized-o2
abi_requirements: optimized lowering preserves selector-surface and method-thunk ABI split from -O0
optimized lowering preserves separate-compilation compatibility for exported method thunk signatures
optimized lowering preserves status/error invariants for async throws method callbacks
runtime_assertions: selector identity and exactly-once callback behavior remain stable under optimization
status/error observations in callback remain equivalent to -O0

abi_field_stability.required_shape: method-exported thunk uses canonical async completion signature and trailing context/completion order
selector spelling remains source-level while ABI details live in lowered call surface and metadata
